item.title: Nslookup Quick Reference Guide
item.description: Introduction nslookup is a network administration command-line tool available in most operating systems, including Windows, macOS, and Linux. It is used for querying the Domain Name System (DNS) to obtain domain name or IP address mapping information. This tool is essential for network diagnostics and troubleshooting DNS issues. Key Features of nslookup Query DNS Records: nslookup can query specific DNS record types, such as A (address), MX (mail exchange), NS (name server), and TXT (text) records.

item.title: BIND Troubleshooting Guide (Ubuntu Server)
item.description: Introduction BIND (Berkeley Internet Name Domain) is a widely used DNS server software. This guide focuses on troubleshooting BIND on Ubuntu Server 20.04. It assumes that BIND is already installed and configured, and you are experiencing issues. Troubleshooting Steps 1. Check BIND Status To get an overview of the BIND service status: sudo systemctl status bind9 This command helps identify if BIND is active or if there are any service-related errors.
